description: This is exactly the convenient OCR tool I was looking for. Just run, select an area you want to extract text from and it's copied to your clipboard.
I highly recommend this app—it's straightforward and works well. It's an OCR app that captures text through screenshots, making it very convenient to use

This OCR app is amazing but a few small issues. I wish it was more easily done, via a shortcut instead of having to open the app. Wait 2 seconds for it to have the pink border around your screen then you can OCR whatever it is. I love that it goes straight to your clipboard. If it was more seamless so no waiting, I just use a shortcut and bam, ocr text ready to go I'd give the app 5 stars.
Didn't work on Fedora 39 crashed after selecting text

Initially when I first installed this app, it didn't work at all. I removed it and re-installed it.

It finally worked. I can see where this app could be very handy in many instances. When you start the app, you should see a large square outlining your monitor screen. Drag your mouse over the section you want the OCR to render into text. Once done, the app will close off.
NormCap takes fewer clicks than most other apps like this, and it does a great job of reading the text correctly
Perfect OCR recognition. It even recognize meaningless words correctly.
It fetches most of the words which is too good. Thank you for such a great tool.
summary: It fetches most of the words

description: Does what it say, no fuss, no ui noise. Just launch the app, select a region and the text is in your clipboard.
Worked first time, no hassle, straight 'out of the box' just what I needed and VERY simple to use - well done !
summary: First Time, just what I needed

description: Thank you very much for this awesome aplication
It looks great and seems like it's exactly what I want but I just can't seem to get it to work.

Works great! Character recognition could be improved in some edge cases (e.g. when weird fonts are being used, or the text has some effects applied). But overall it's very usable.
On KDE Wayland (installed as a flatpak) I don't have any tray icon, so I just pinned it to my Task bar and open it whenever I need to OCR something on my screen.

Perfect when launching with ctrl+print shortcut.
It took me a while to notice the setting in the upper-right corner.

Seems to work, but I wish there was a way to control settings, such as sensitivity, and a notification displayed when the OCR process has completed and text embedded into the clipboard. Also, (maybe this is a 'nice to have' for Fedora and not NormCap) a way to bind a kb shortcut, like Opt+PrtSc button combination, to trigger NormCap would be pretty awesome.

Despite the 'buts', I am 5-starring it, because it does what it states on the tin, and does it very well (especially for a FOSS app).

To the dev: nice job! And thank you for your contribution to the FOSS market.
It's great. Can read text mostly with no problem. Thanks everybody who contributes this cool application.
Only crashes...
Es fácil y transcribe perfecto, sin errores.
summary: Funciona mejor y es más eficiente que los online, gracias compañeros!!

description: Cumple con lo prometido
Приложение падает после снятия скриншота, так и не выдав ответ.
